name: Philippe Morere at GitHub.io
body:
## A few personal projects
Some stuff about machine learning:
* A few [Reinforcement Learning algorithms](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/RLinBURLAP) using the [BURLAP](http://burlap.cs.brown.edu/) library. The project includes an improved Doormax learner, a grammar-based learner, a Sokoban domain for BURLAP, and a [Instructional Scaffolding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instructional_scaffolding) framework for the previous learning algorithms.
* [jCaffe](https://github.com/fastturtle/jCaffe), java bindings for [Caffe](http://caffe.berkeleyvision.org).
* A [Simple Neural Network](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/SimpleNeuralNetwork) developped in java, trained with back-propagation, to experiment a little bit.
* A [Toy Reinforcement Learning](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/BasicReinforcementLearning) example, to experiment Q-Learning.
* [Learning to play Pacman](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/PacmanRL) with some Q-Learning algorithms

A few games that I made:
* [Froggy](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/Froggy) -- Android game, you can download if from the Google play market [here](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mopgames).
* A Minecraft clone (no code available on GitHub).
* [Bomberman](https://github.com/PhilippeMorere/Bomberman) -- Bomberman-like game, written in C with the SDL, multiplayer.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
